metadata.title: CVE-2023-2008 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's udmabuf device driver. The specificflaw exists within a fault handler. The issue results from the lack ofproper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a memoryaccess past the end of an array. An attacker can leverage thisvulnerability to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in thecontext of the kernel.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2008` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-126-generic - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-126-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1').
